organizations in the fields of corporate social responsibility (CSR) and sustainability reporting

projects:
[{'title': 'Pillars In Practice: Roundtable in garments sector in Bangladesh', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'description': 'On May 12-15, SAI, the Danish Institute for Human Rights (DiHR), and the CSR Centre Bangladesh jointly convened two segments of the Pillars in Practice (PIP) Program in Dhaka - a 'Training of Trainers' (ToT) and the "Multi-Stakeholder Advisory Consultation" (MAC) forum to discuss the garment sector's impacts on human rights in Bangladesh.

Looking exclusively at the ready-made garment sector in Bangladesh, both sought to advance the implementation of the UN Guiding Principles for Business and Human Rights by government ministries, garment manufacturers, trade unions, and civil society organizations.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Musarrat', 'last_name': 'H.', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Finance and Sustainability Professional'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Shahamin', 'last_name': 'S. Zaman', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Sustainability Expert'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Eliza', 'last_name': 'W.', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Licensed Clinical Social Worker | Psychotherapist '}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Sanchita', 'last_name': 'Sapkota', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Sr. Revenue Accountant'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Farhana', 'last_name': 'Sharmin', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Head of CSR at IDLC Finance Limited'}]}, {'title': 'Developing the National CSR Guideline for Bangladesh', 'date': {'start': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'description': 'CSR Centre, in partnership with the Royal Danish Embassy in Bangladesh, is developing the National CSR Guideline for Bangladesh. The objectives of the project are :

To help formulate a private sector led National CSR Guidelines a well as to support prioritization of CSR reform in the context of the overall development strategy.

In consultation with public and industrial stakeholders, develop appropriate CSR positions that will encompass human rights, labor standards, anti-corruption and environmental aspects.

The objective of the project is to enable worker manager dialogue, especially for issues related to gender discrimination and sexual harassment, Gender sensitization of workers, supervisors and managers on gender equality by focusing on attitudinal changes, empowering factories to initiate improvement projects based on outcomes of the dialogue process, going beyond factory audits for the brand and building local capacity in accordance to WEP Principles.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Musarrat', 'last_name': 'H.', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Finance and Sustainability Professional'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Laila', 'last_name': 'Shemonto', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Corporate Social Responsibility |Sustainability | Gender Equality | Development Professional '}]}, {'title': 'Assessment of Market Sensitiveness and Market Environment for Cotton Supply Chain in Bangladesh.', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'description': 'The study was focused to understand the bottlenecks in terms of procedures and policies in the cotton supply chain that affects the performance of the whole textile supply chain. It focused on mapping potential stakeholders in developing effective collaboration among different actors towards achieving responsiveness and efficiency of the sector.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Musarrat', 'last_name': 'H.', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Finance and Sustainability Professional'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Tashrique', 'last_name': 'Shahab', 'name': None, 'headline': 'CSR Manager'}]}, {'title': 'Pillars in Practice', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'description': "'Pillars in Practice' is an 18 month initiative jointly implemented by Social Accountability International (SAI), the Danish Institute for Human Rights(DIHR) in partnership with the CSR Centre (Bangladesh).

The Global Compact Network Bangladesh was launched on 26 January 2009 by the CSR Centre (CSRC) and the Bangladesh Enterprise Institute (BEI). BEI and CSRC have been designated as representatives of the Bangladesh Network.

The Bangladesh Network is comprised of 57 signatories of the UN Global Compact that are committed to implementing the UN Global Compact principles and to achieving long-term corporate excellence while setting a standard for socially responsible business practices in Bangladesh.
